intro: Weinmannia cundinamarcensis, commonly known as the Cundinamarca weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cunoniaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features elliptical, glossy leaves with a prominent midrib, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
